article.headline: Cent. Arkansas 62, SE Louisiana 59
article.story: CONWAY, Ark. -- Tadre Sheppard scored the game's final four points to lift Central Arkansas to a 62-59 victory over Southeastern Louisiana on Wednesday night. Mike Pouncy and Imad Qahwash each had 13 points, and the Bears (5-14, 1-5 Southland) ended a six-game losing streak. Trent Hutchin led the Lions (8-9, 2-3) with 12 points and David Ndoumba had 10. Down 59-58 after Rodney Jones scored on a layup with 1:50 to play, Central Arkansas went up by one after two free throws by Sheppard with 38 seconds remaining. Southeastern Louisiana then missed two jumpers before Sheppard sealed it with two more foul shots with 6 seconds left. Sheppard finished with six points. The Lions rallied to take a five-point lead late in the second half after trailing by as much as 16 in the first but missed their final five shots.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
